page.title: 17Tourism 2
page.content: One of the best known views looks across to the Eildon Hills.This is known as Scott's View,a popular place to stop.THe Eildon Hills are the most famous Borders landmark.After a fairly easy climb, the visitor can stand on top of Middle Eildon and gain a breathtaking view of the landscape. For the sporting St.Boswells offers a 9 hole course with a new clubhouse.The Tweed is famous for its fishing for trout and salmon.Permits for local fishing are available in local shops.The area is managed by the Local Angling Association. Apart from the road traffic increasing tourism has little effect on the villages.It does not bring much business to local shops. Most foreign tourist associate our area with knitwear shops, and our local ones have closed.
